e4: The current policy has been disclosed to investors, who take it into account when making investment decisions. Switching to a new policy that reports true earnings without bias could lead to short-term gains from higher stock prices, but ultimately result in lower long-term performance as investors adjust their expectations downward. This would disadvantage small retail investors who may not be aware of the change in policy.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness. It should disclose all relevant information to stakeholders in a clear and unbiased manner, without hiding or misrepresenting data to achieve a particular outcome. In the context of financial reporting, this means presenting true earnings and performance without adjustments or manipulations, unless explicitly disclosed as part of a recognized accounting standard or practice.
e6: Yes, I would ask management to provide more information on how they plan to communicate the change in policy to investors and whether they have any plans to implement measures that protect small retail investors from being disadvantaged by this change.
